com.bluegosling.concurrent.futures.fluent

Class CombiningFluentFuture<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bluegosling.concurrent.futures.fluent.AbstractFluentFuture<T>
      • com.bluegosling.concurrent.futures.fluent.CombiningFluentFuture<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the combined result
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Awaitable, Cancellable, FluentFuture<T>, Future<T>

    public abstract class CombiningFluentFuture<T>
extends AbstractFluentFuture<T>
    An abstract future that combines the results from other futures. General use entails calling code to mark() this future as each constituent future completes. Subclasses are responsible for collecting these results and then implementing computeValue() to actually combine the results into a single value.

      Constructs a new combining future.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CombiningFluentFuture

        protected CombiningFluentFuture(Collection<FluentFuture<?>> components)
        Constructs a new combining future. The specified list should be immutable. Its size is used to determine how many components must be marked before a result can be ready. If this combined future is cancelled, this class attempts to cancel all of the underlying components as well.
        Parameters:
        components - the list of component futures

    • Method Detail

        protected abstract T computeValue()
        Computes the combined value of this future once all components have completed.
        Returns:

        public boolean cancel(boolean mayInterrupt)
        Description copied from interface: Cancellable
        Cancels the activity.

        Specified by:

        Overrides:
        cancel in class AbstractFluentFuture<T>
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if the activity was cancelled; false if it could not be cancelled because the activity has already completed
